issue.title: contains comparer doesn't work for structs
issue.body:
Currently any struct embedded or not have any contains behavior. 
We need to allow contains logic for every string, map and slice inside of a struct 
and/or allow the ability to selectively decide how the contains should run for a Struct Field

payload.description: A simple golang testing support package making Table Driven Tests easier to write.

release.body:
## What's Changed
* Convert Trial to generics by @jbsmith7741 in https://github.com/hydronica/trial/pull/12

**Note**: This is a breaking changesee [wiki](https://github.com/hydronica/trial/wiki/Upgrading) for guide and more details

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/hydronica/trial/compare/v0.6.3...v0.7.0

What's Changed

  • Convert Trial to generics by @jbsmith7741 in #12

Note: This is a breaking changesee wiki for guide and more details

Full Changelog: v0.6.3...v0.7.0

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,92 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+db        - required database name to use for query connections
+table     - required table name to validate
+dt_column - required column name that holds the date value to query
+date      - the date to compare data against tolerance level
+offset    - if given, this is the offset duration back from date to compare tolerance
+tolerance - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
+              0.05 (5%) means the difference between the row counts can vary by 5 percent and be accepted
+              a greater difference would send an alert, if compare is not provided this check is not done
+
+Example task 
+(table.schema checked for records where my_date = 2022-01-02 and 2022-01-01 has 10% as many records as 2022-01-02):
+  {"type":"task.dbcheck","info":"?db=mydbname&table=table.schema&dt_column=my_date&date=2022-01-02&offset=24h&tolerance=0.1"}`
+)
+
+type Postgres struct {
+	Host        string `toml:"host"`
+	User        string `toml:"username"`
+	Pass        string `toml:"password"`
+	DBName      string `toml:"dbname"`
+	SSLMode     string `toml:"sslmode" comment:"default is disable, use require for ssl"`
+	SSLCert     string `toml:"sslcert"`
+	SSLKey      string `toml:"sslkey"`
+	SSLRootcert string `toml:"sslrootcert"`
+
+	DB *sqlx.DB
+}
+
+type options struct {
+	Slack string `toml:"slack"`
+
+	Bus  *bus.Options        `toml:"bus"`
+	Psql map[string]Postgres `toml:"postgres"` // mulitple postgres db connections name:settings
+
+	producer bus.Producer
+}
+
+func main() {
+	log.SetFlags(log.LstdFlags | log.Lshortfile)
+
+	o := &options{
+		Psql: make(map[string]Postgres),
+	}
+
+	app := bootstrap.NewWorkerApp(taskType, o.newWorker, o).
+		Version(tools.String()).
+		Description(description).
+		Initialize()
+
+	o.producer = app.NewProducer()
+
+	app.Run()
+}
+
+// database connection validation
+func (o *options) Validate() (err error) {
+	// check each psql connection
+	for name, c := range o.Psql {
+		// connect to iap database (salesforce data)
comment.body: remove comment

issue.title: Ignore fields
issue.body:
Add the ability to ignore certain fields. This is particularly helpful for time fields that are being populated by time.Now(). 

Options: 
- ignore fields with a - tag `trial:"-"` 
- add a comparer function that takes in fields to ignore (similar to cmp.Diff's options)

issue.title: Ignore fields
issue.body:
Add the ability to ignore certain fields. This is particularly helpful for time fields that are being populated by time.Now(). 

Options: 
- ignore fields with a - tag `trial:"-"` 
- add a comparer function that takes in fields to ignore (similar to cmp.Diff's options)

comment.body: This was completed with EqualOptions function added in #7

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+table      - required table name to validate
+date_field - required field name that holds the date value
+date1      - 1st date value to check for records
+date2      - 2nd date to compare row counts between date1 and date2
+offset     - if date2 is not given, this is the offset duration back from date1 to get date2
+percent    - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
comment.body: Tolerance is a better description of what it does.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,157 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"context"
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+	"math"
+	"time"
+
+	"github.com/jbsmith7741/uri"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/slack"
+)
+
+type worker struct {
+	options
+	task.Meta
+	slack *slack.Slack
+
+	Table     string    `uri:"table" required:"true"`      // name of the table to query
+	DateField string    `uri:"date_field" required:"true"` // the date field to get row counts
+	Date1     time.Time `uri:"date1" format:"2006-01-02"`  // default is 24h back from today
+	Date2     time.Time `uri:"date2" format:"2006-01-02"`  // 2nd date to compare records against date1
+	Offset    string    `uri:"offset"`                     // duration back from date1 used to determine the value of date2 if needed
+	Percent   float64   `uri:"percent" default:"0.05"`     // allowed difference between date1 and date2 row counts
+}
+
+func (o *options) newWorker(info string) task.Worker {
+	w := &worker{
+		options: *o, // copy option values
+		Meta:    task.NewMeta(),
+		Date1:   time.Now().Add(-time.Hour * 24), // default date is yesterday
+		slack:   &slack.Slack{Url: o.Slack},
+	}
+
+	if err := uri.Unmarshal(info, w); err != nil {
+		return task.InvalidWorker("params uri.unmarshal: %v", err)
+	}
+
+	return w
+}
+
+// RecordCount returns the row count for the given column field, and date
+func (w *worker) RecordCount(ctx context.Context, field string, date time.Time) (rows int, err error) {
+	q := "select count(0) r from " + w.Table + " where date(" + field + ") = $1"
comment.body: should we be using Prepared statements and Query Params instead of string construction?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+table      - required table name to validate
+date_field - required field name that holds the date value
+date1      - 1st date value to check for records
+date2      - 2nd date to compare row counts between date1 and date2
+offset     - if date2 is not given, this is the offset duration back from date1 to get date2
+percent    - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
+              0.05 (5%) means the difference between the row counts can vary by 5 percent and be accepted
+              a greater difference would send an alert, if compare is not provided this check is not done
+
+Example task 
+(affiliate.publishers table has records from 24h ago, the difference between 24h and 48h row counts should not vary more than 5%): 
+  {"type":"task.dbcheck","info":"db_name?table=affiliate.publishers&compare=48h&percent=0.05"}`
comment.body:
Can we make this more generic?
"info":"db_name?table=`schema.table`&compare=48h&percent=0.05"

Also the example shows the db_name as the path, but the description shows it as a query param

comment.body: It would be better to remove the default value and force the request to be explicit so that it is easier to rerun tasks and understand what is being compared.

comment.body:
🤔 
Is there a value to make these easier to understand maybe we could do a custom struct to get the point across something like 
`date=2022-05-17:-24h` or `date=2022-05-17:2022-06-12` or we could allow an array of dates to compare against each other so `date=2022-05-17,2022-06-12`

review.body:
A couple of thoughts

Is it better to have the db-check app send out slack messages or should all slack messages be handled by flowlord and we add a new **alert** result that flowlord messages on? 

Will db-check support different types of checks or just that the data exists?

commits.message:
add userinfo (username/password) (#25)

* add userinfo (username/password)

* add go 1.18 and 1.19 tests

* update authority to include userinfo instead of scheme

pull_request.title: add userinfo (username/password)
pull_request.body:
- Add support for userinfo, username and password. 
- Update `authority` to include userinfo + host instead of scheme + host which is correct. 
- `Origin` ignores userinfo and still includes the path.

issue.title: Ignore fields
issue.body:
Add the ability to ignore certain fields. This is particularly helpful for time fields that are being populated by time.Now(). 

Options: 
- ignore fields with a - tag `trial:"-"` 
- add a comparer function that takes in fields to ignore (similar to cmp.Diff's options)

issue.title: Ignore fields
issue.body:
Add the ability to ignore certain fields. This is particularly helpful for time fields that are being populated by time.Now(). 

Options: 
- ignore fields with a - tag `trial:"-"` 
- add a comparer function that takes in fields to ignore (similar to cmp.Diff's options)

comment.body: This was completed with EqualOptions function added in #7

@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+table      - required table name to validate
+date_field - required field name that holds the date value
+date1      - 1st date value to check for records
+date2      - 2nd date to compare row counts between date1 and date2
+offset     - if date2 is not given, this is the offset duration back from date1 to get date2
+percent    - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
comment.body: Tolerance is a better description of what it does.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,157 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"context"
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+	"math"
+	"time"
+
+	"github.com/jbsmith7741/uri"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/slack"
+)
+
+type worker struct {
+	options
+	task.Meta
+	slack *slack.Slack
+
+	Table     string    `uri:"table" required:"true"`      // name of the table to query
+	DateField string    `uri:"date_field" required:"true"` // the date field to get row counts
+	Date1     time.Time `uri:"date1" format:"2006-01-02"`  // default is 24h back from today
+	Date2     time.Time `uri:"date2" format:"2006-01-02"`  // 2nd date to compare records against date1
+	Offset    string    `uri:"offset"`                     // duration back from date1 used to determine the value of date2 if needed
+	Percent   float64   `uri:"percent" default:"0.05"`     // allowed difference between date1 and date2 row counts
+}
+
+func (o *options) newWorker(info string) task.Worker {
+	w := &worker{
+		options: *o, // copy option values
+		Meta:    task.NewMeta(),
+		Date1:   time.Now().Add(-time.Hour * 24), // default date is yesterday
+		slack:   &slack.Slack{Url: o.Slack},
+	}
+
+	if err := uri.Unmarshal(info, w); err != nil {
+		return task.InvalidWorker("params uri.unmarshal: %v", err)
+	}
+
+	return w
+}
+
+// RecordCount returns the row count for the given column field, and date
+func (w *worker) RecordCount(ctx context.Context, field string, date time.Time) (rows int, err error) {
+	q := "select count(0) r from " + w.Table + " where date(" + field + ") = $1"
comment.body: should we be using Prepared statements and Query Params instead of string construction?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,86 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+table      - required table name to validate
+date_field - required field name that holds the date value
+date1      - 1st date value to check for records
+date2      - 2nd date to compare row counts between date1 and date2
+offset     - if date2 is not given, this is the offset duration back from date1 to get date2
+percent    - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
+              0.05 (5%) means the difference between the row counts can vary by 5 percent and be accepted
+              a greater difference would send an alert, if compare is not provided this check is not done
+
+Example task 
+(affiliate.publishers table has records from 24h ago, the difference between 24h and 48h row counts should not vary more than 5%): 
+  {"type":"task.dbcheck","info":"db_name?table=affiliate.publishers&compare=48h&percent=0.05"}`
comment.body:
Can we make this more generic?
"info":"db_name?table=`schema.table`&compare=48h&percent=0.05"

Also the example shows the db_name as the path, but the description shows it as a query param

comment.body:
🤔 
Is there a value to make these easier to understand maybe we could do a custom struct to get the point across something like 
`date=2022-05-17:-24h` or `date=2022-05-17:2022-06-12` or we could allow an array of dates to compare against each other so `date=2022-05-17,2022-06-12`

review.body:
A couple of thoughts

Is it better to have the db-check app send out slack messages or should all slack messages be handled by flowlord and we add a new **alert** result that flowlord messages on? 

Will db-check support different types of checks or just that the data exists?

pull_request.title: add userinfo (username/password)
pull_request.body:
- Add support for userinfo, username and password. 
- Update `authority` to include userinfo + host instead of scheme + host which is correct. 
- `Origin` ignores userinfo and still includes the path.

issue.title: contains comparer doesn't work for structs
issue.body:
Currently any struct embedded or not have any contains behavior. 
We need to allow contains logic for every string, map and slice inside of a struct 
and/or allow the ability to selectively decide how the contains should run for a Struct Field

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,92 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+db        - required database name to use for query connections
+table     - required table name to validate
+dt_column - required column name that holds the date value to query
+date      - the date to compare data against tolerance level
+offset    - if given, this is the offset duration back from date to compare tolerance
+tolerance - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
+              0.05 (5%) means the difference between the row counts can vary by 5 percent and be accepted
+              a greater difference would send an alert, if compare is not provided this check is not done
+
+Example task 
+(table.schema checked for records where my_date = 2022-01-02 and 2022-01-01 has 10% as many records as 2022-01-02):
+  {"type":"task.dbcheck","info":"?db=mydbname&table=table.schema&dt_column=my_date&date=2022-01-02&offset=24h&tolerance=0.1"}`
+)
+
+type Postgres struct {
+	Host        string `toml:"host"`
+	User        string `toml:"username"`
+	Pass        string `toml:"password"`
+	DBName      string `toml:"dbname"`
+	SSLMode     string `toml:"sslmode" comment:"default is disable, use require for ssl"`
+	SSLCert     string `toml:"sslcert"`
+	SSLKey      string `toml:"sslkey"`
+	SSLRootcert string `toml:"sslrootcert"`
+
+	DB *sqlx.DB
+}
+
+type options struct {
+	Slack string `toml:"slack"`
+
+	Bus  *bus.Options        `toml:"bus"`
+	Psql map[string]Postgres `toml:"postgres"` // mulitple postgres db connections name:settings
+
+	producer bus.Producer
+}
+
+func main() {
+	log.SetFlags(log.LstdFlags | log.Lshortfile)
+
+	o := &options{
+		Psql: make(map[string]Postgres),
+	}
+
+	app := bootstrap.NewWorkerApp(taskType, o.newWorker, o).
+		Version(tools.String()).
+		Description(description).
+		Initialize()
+
+	o.producer = app.NewProducer()
+
+	app.Run()
+}
+
+// database connection validation
+func (o *options) Validate() (err error) {
+	// check each psql connection
+	for name, c := range o.Psql {
+		// connect to iap database (salesforce data)
comment.body: remove comment

+package main
+
+import (
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+
+	"github.com/jmoiron/sqlx"
+	tools "github.com/pcelvng/task-tools"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/bootstrap"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/db"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task/bus"
+)
+
+const (
+	taskType    = "task.dbcheck"
+	description = `
+Runs record count checks against a given table's data to verify that the data is updated as expected
+
+uri params:
+table      - required table name to validate
+date_field - required field name that holds the date value
+date1      - 1st date value to check for records
+date2      - 2nd date to compare row counts between date1 and date2
+offset     - if date2 is not given, this is the offset duration back from date1 to get date2
+percent    - (default 0.05) percent is the allowed percentage of deviation between offset and compare row counts
+              0.05 (5%) means the difference between the row counts can vary by 5 percent and be accepted
+              a greater difference would send an alert, if compare is not provided this check is not done
+
+Example task 
+(affiliate.publishers table has records from 24h ago, the difference between 24h and 48h row counts should not vary more than 5%): 
+  {"type":"task.dbcheck","info":"db_name?table=affiliate.publishers&compare=48h&percent=0.05"}`
comment.body:
Can we make this more generic?
"info":"db_name?table=`schema.table`&compare=48h&percent=0.05"

Also the example shows the db_name as the path, but the description shows it as a query param

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,157 @@
+package main
+
+import (
+	"context"
+	"fmt"
+	"log"
+	"math"
+	"time"
+
+	"github.com/jbsmith7741/uri"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task"
+	"github.com/pcelvng/task-tools/slack"
+)
+
+type worker struct {
+	options
+	task.Meta
+	slack *slack.Slack
+
+	Table     string    `uri:"table" required:"true"`      // name of the table to query
+	DateField string    `uri:"date_field" required:"true"` // the date field to get row counts
+	Date1     time.Time `uri:"date1" format:"2006-01-02"`  // default is 24h back from today
+	Date2     time.Time `uri:"date2" format:"2006-01-02"`  // 2nd date to compare records against date1
+	Offset    string    `uri:"offset"`                     // duration back from date1 used to determine the value of date2 if needed
+	Percent   float64   `uri:"percent" default:"0.05"`     // allowed difference between date1 and date2 row counts
+}
+
+func (o *options) newWorker(info string) task.Worker {
+	w := &worker{
+		options: *o, // copy option values
+		Meta:    task.NewMeta(),
+		Date1:   time.Now().Add(-time.Hour * 24), // default date is yesterday
comment.body: It would be better to remove the default value and force the request to be explicit so that it is easier to rerun tasks and understand what is being compared.

comment.body:
🤔 
Is there a value to make these easier to understand maybe we could do a custom struct to get the point across something like 
`date=2022-05-17:-24h` or `date=2022-05-17:2022-06-12` or we could allow an array of dates to compare against each other so `date=2022-05-17,2022-06-12`

review.body:
A couple of thoughts

Is it better to have the db-check app send out slack messages or should all slack messages be handled by flowlord and we add a new **alert** result that flowlord messages on? 

Will db-check support different types of checks or just that the data exists?

repo.description: A simple golang testing support package making Table Driven Tests easier to write.

commits.message:
add userinfo (username/password) (#25)

* add userinfo (username/password)

* add go 1.18 and 1.19 tests

* update authority to include userinfo instead of scheme

pull_request.title: add userinfo (username/password)
pull_request.body:
- Add support for userinfo, username and password. 
- Update `authority` to include userinfo + host instead of scheme + host which is correct. 
- `Origin` ignores userinfo and still includes the path.
